name: VS Code Controls
description: Quickly control Visual Studio Code via AppleScript and CLI commands. Supports opening new windows, opening selected files or folders from Finder, and managing and installing extensions.

commands.name: Open New Window
commands.description: Open a new Visual Studio Code window.

commands.name: Show Installed Extensions
commands.description: Manage installed extensions in Visual Studio Code.

args: osascript -e 'tell application "Visual Studio Code" to activate' -e 'tell application "System Events" to keystroke "x" using {command down, shift down}'

commands.name: Open with Visual Studio Code
commands.description: Open the currently selected Finder item with VS Code.

args: osascript -e 'tell application "Finder" to activate' -e 'set theFile to POSIX path of (choose file with prompt "Select a file to open in VS Code:")' -e 'do shell script "code --new-window \"" & theFile & "\""'

commands.name: Search Recent Projects
commands.description: Search recent projects from VS Code

args: osascript -e 'tell application "Visual Studio Code" to activate' -e 'delay 0.3' -e 'tell application "System Events" to keystroke "r" using control down'
